did.unittitle: Council of Chief State School Officers, Director of International Education's records

origination.label: Creator
origination.persname: Council of Chief State School Officers. Director of International Education.

did.abstract: Established in 1927, the Council of Chief State School Officers (CCSSO) undertakes projects to help U.S. state education agencies develop and implement educational policies and advocates for educational reforms at the state and national levels. Dr. Fred Czarra was the Director of International Education and Specialist in Social Studies and Interdisciplinary Learning at the Council for Chief State School Officers (CCSSO) from 1986-2006. The collection includes CCSSO committee meeting minutes, grant projects and reports, correspondence, curriculum standards, lesson plans, and publications, as well as a small amount of Czarra's personal papers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required for access to collection.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Established in 1927, the Council of Chief State School Officers (CCSSO) is a U.S. nonpartisan, nonprofit organization of public officials who head departments of elementary and secondary education in each state and five U.S. extra-state jurisdictions. CCSSO leads and facilitates collective state action to transform the public education system and advocates on federal education matters before Congress and the U.S. Department of Education. The organization also undertakes projects to help state education agencies to develop and implement educational reforms and to collaborate in the development of best practices and model solutions.

Fred R. Czarra is an author, educator, historian, and was the CCSSO Director of International Education and Specialist in Social Studies and Interdisciplinary Learning from 1986 to 2006. From 1994-2006 he was also the coordinator for the CCSSO Comprehensive Social Studies Assessment Project, a consortium of 25 states funded by the U.S. Department of Education with the purpose of developing high level thinking assessments and portfolios in civics, economics, geography, and history for elementary and secondary students. In addition to his work with the CCSSO, Czarra served as the executive editor of the Social Studies from 1975-1990.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized into four series: Administrative files, Correspondence, Publications, and Subject files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the activities of the Council of Chief State School Officers (CCSSO) during Fred R. Czarra's time as Director of International Education and Specialist in Social Studies and Interdisciplinary Learning. It also includes a small amount of Czarra's personal papers, including non-CCSSO publications authored by Czarra and files related to his education consulting work.
The collection is organized into four series: Administrative files, Correspondence, Publications, and Subject files.

The Administrative files series include minutes, reports, correspondence, and related documents of various Council of Chief State Officers committees on which Czarra served, as well as documents regarding collaborations between CCSSO and/or Czarra with other Global/International Education organizations. The series is further organized into three subseries: Committees, Collaborations, and Grants. The Committees subseries includes documents from CCSSO's International Relations, International Education Committees, and the International Education Council. Collaborations includes documents reflecting partnership between CCSSO and other organizations and institutions. The Grants subseries includes proposals reports and other related documents.

Correspondence includes general communication and communication with federal, state, foreign, governments and institutions and private organizations, including former New Jersey Governor, Thomas Keane.

The Publications series contains an article, books, booklets, journals, newsletters, reports, and white papers authored, edited, or sponsored by Czarra and/or CCSSO regarding international educational practices and issues.
Subject files contain miscellaneous documents including workshop materials created by Czarra.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: This collection forms part of the Global & International Education Archive.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Council of Chief State School Officers, Director of International Education's records, Collection C368, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Center for the Study of Global Change (CSGC) transferred the collection to the Indiana University Archives. The records had previously been donated to the CSGC by Fred Czarra.
